intro: Uncaria paucinervis, commonly known as the slender cat's claw, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and small, opposite leaves with few veins. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers followed by small, red berries that contain the seeds. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological studies.
